creator: dmiller@kyrus.com
text:
My CLASS_PATH environment variable is set to:  "c:\program files\Interbase 
Corp\Interclient\interclient.jar".

Note that it contains the ".  I had to change the bat file to enclose 
LOCAL_CLASSPATH with single quotes in order for it to work:

   "%JAVACMD% -classpath '%LOCALCLASSPATH%' ...

creator: conor@apache.org
text:
In general, you can happily define an environment variable containing spaces. It
is best to quote at the time of use. Can you try defining your CLASSPATH without
quotes

set CLASSPATH=c:\program files\Interbase Corp\Interclient\interclient.jar

creator: dmiller@kyrus.com
text:
The double quotes were added to get around a problem with one of my development 
tools that could not support embedded blanks in the classpath.  I think it was 
a version of Cafe.  I got around the problem easily enough by changing the 
double quotes in the ant.bat file to single quotes. 

I would remove the quotes but that breaks some other tool.  If this is a 
limitation, then fine I can live with it.  I just wanted to point it out.
